intro: Maripa reticulata var. reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined maripa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
